sen.j: 伏見宮邦輔親王（ふしみのみや くにすけしんのう、永正10年3月20日 （1513年4月25日） - 永禄6年3月26日 （1563年4月18日））は、戦国時代 の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kunisuke (April 25, 1513 - April 18, 1563) was the Imperial family member during the period of Civil War.
Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kunisuke (April 25, 1513 - April 18, 1563) was an Imperial family member during the Civil War period.
Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kunisuke (April 25, 1513 - April 18, 1563) was an Imperial family member during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除。戦国時代→the Sengoku period (period of warring states)[用語集に統一]

sen.e: He was Shikibukyo (Chief of the Ministry of Ceremonial)
He was Shikibukyo (Chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).
He was Shikibukyo (Chief of the Ministry of Ceremonies).
The seventh family head of Fushiminomiya
The seventh family head of Fushiminomiya
The seventh family head of Fushiminomiya.

sen.j: 伏見宮貞敦親王第一王子。
sen.e: The first Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadaatsu
The first Prince of Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadaatsu
The first Prince of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadaatsu.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足。ハイフン削除。

sen.j: 母は三条実香の娘・藤原香子。
sen.e: His mother was Saneka SANJO's daughter, Takako (Kaoriko/Koshi) FUJIWARA
His mother was Saneka SANJO's daughter, Takako (Kaoriko/Koshi) FUJIWARA
His mother was Saneka SANJO's daughter, Takako (Kaoriko/Koshi) FUJIWARA

sen.j: 享禄4年（1531年）に親王宣下、翌天文 (元号)元年（1532年）に元服。
sen.e: He received to title to become Imperial Prince in 1531 and had a comining-of-age ceremony in 1532.
He received the title of Imperial Prince in 1531 and had a comining-of-age ceremony in 1532.
He received the title of Imperial Prince in 1531 and had a coming-of-age ceremony in 1532.

sen.j: 王子女に、伏見宮貞康親王、伏見宮邦房親王、常胤法親王、尊朝法親王、最胤法親王など
sen.e: The Prince's children are Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadayasu, Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kuninobu, Imperial Prince Join (Buddhist Priest), Imperial Prince Soncho (Buddhist Priest), Imperial Prince Saiin. (Buddhist Priest)

The Prince's children were Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Sadayasu, Imperial Prince Fushimi-no-miya Kuninobu, Imperial Prince Join (Buddhist Priest), Imperial Prince Soncho (Buddhist Priest), Imperial Prince Saiin (Buddhist Priest).

The Prince's children were Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadayasu, Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuninobu, Cloistered Imperial Prince Join (Buddhist Priest), Cloistered Imperial Prince Soncho, Cloistered Imperial Prince Saiin.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除。法親王→Cloistered Imperial Prince に訂正しました。(Buddhist Priest)初出以外削除。

sen.j: 墓地は京都市上京区の伏見宮墓地。
sen.e: His cemetery is in Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
He was laid to rest in Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
He was laid to rest in Fushiminomiya cemetery in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
